data_maturity_score.evidence: Traditional BI tools (Tableau, SQL, Oracle, Hive) without modern data stack mentions. No CI/CD, testing, or governance practices mentioned. Focus on dashboard development rather than modern data engineering infrastructure.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 2 indicates developing maturity - structured BI processes but lacking modern data engineering practices and tooling

maturity_signals.evidence: No modern data stack adoption, CI/CD practices, data quality testing, monitoring, or governance mentioned in job description

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused BI engineer role with clear Tableau/dashboard responsibilities. No evidence of combining multiple roles like DE + DS + DevOps

overtime_risk_score.evidence: IBM Consulting delivery center suggests client-facing work which can be demanding. No work-life balance signals mentioned, but no explicit red flags either

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined BI engineer role focused on Tableau dashboard development, analytics, and business requirements translation

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk - consulting environment may have demanding hours, but role is well-defined and focused. IBM provides stability

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No reporting structure, manager level, or team hierarchy mentioned in job description

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager titles or reporting relationships mentioned

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No team growth, expansion, or hiring velocity mentioned

team_composition.evidence: No team size, composition, or structure information provided

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure mentioned in job description

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: IBM Consulting delivery center model suggests centralized consulting team rather than embedded cross-functional teams

work_life_balance_score.evidence: No work-life balance signals mentioned. IBM Consulting delivery centers often have demanding client schedules. No PTO, flexibility, or balance policies mentioned

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Mentions 'limitless career path' and 'latest education, tools and technology' but lacks specific details. IBM provides scale and brand value for career growth

tech_culture_score.evidence: Traditional BI focus with established tools. No modern engineering practices, open source, or innovation culture mentioned. Conservative, enterprise-focused approach

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No tech culture signals mentioned - no open source, tech blogs, conferences, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No development practices mentioned - no code review, CI/CD, testing, monitoring, or engineering best practices

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on maintaining existing Tableau dashboards and content management systems rather than innovation or new technology exploration

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of modernizing systems, improving code quality, or addressing technical debt

ai_integration_level.evidence: No AI, ML, or advanced analytics mentioned. Pure BI/Tableau focus with traditional dashboard development

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools mentioned - focus is entirely on Tableau, SQL, Oracle, and Hive for traditional BI

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgent timeline mentioned. Standard IBM hiring process for consulting delivery center position

competition_level.evidence: IBM brand attracts candidates, but location in Pune and traditional BI focus may limit competition compared to modern tech companies

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a well-established enterprise technology company with global consulting operations

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM Consulting delivery centers typically have steady hiring to support client engagements

team_size_signals.evidence: No team size information mentioned in job description

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded, established enterprise company

role_creation_type.evidence: No indication of whether this is new headcount, backfill, or team expansion

strength_details: IBM provides enterprise stability and global scale opportunities
Clear BI engineer role with specific Tableau focus and requirements
Opportunity to work with diverse clients through consulting delivery center
Master's degree preferred rather than required, showing flexibility
concern_details: Traditional BI stack (Tableau, SQL, Oracle, Hive) without modern data engineering tools
Onsite requirement in Pune, Maharashtra with no remote flexibility mentioned
Vague career growth path despite 'limitless career path' claim
IBM Consulting delivery center may have demanding client schedules and hours
best_fit_details: Mid-level BI engineers with 3-6 years Tableau experience seeking stable enterprise role
Analytics engineers focused on dashboard development and business requirements translation
Candidates comfortable with traditional BI tools and consulting environment
probe_details: Ask about team size, reporting structure, and management hierarchy
Understand typical work hours, overtime expectations, and client delivery timelines
Clarify career progression opportunities and skill development paths
Learn about types of clients and projects this role would support
leverage_details: Strong Tableau Desktop and Server experience is core requirement
Proven track record with large dataset optimization and dashboard performance
Business requirements translation skills are key differentiator
summary.overall_assessment: Solid BI engineer opportunity at stable enterprise company with clear technical requirements. Traditional BI focus may limit modern data engineering exposure. Pune location and consulting model require consideration. Good fit for candidates seeking Tableau specialization within enterprise environment.
